key_points: The head armorer of 'Rust' was reported to be 'careless' with guns on set.
Allegedly gave an improperly checked gun to 11-year-old actress Ryan Kiera Armstrong on a previous film set.
New Mexico Occupational Health and Safety Bureau is investigating the shooting accident on 'Rust' that killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins.
Two production sources claimed an incident where the armorer, Hannah Gutierrez-Reed, handed a loaded weapon to a child without checking for barrel obstructions.
Crew members had to intervene and filming was paused until the firearm was properly checked.
Gutierrez-Reed had previously expressed concerns over her experience level for the role.
This was her second film as a head gun handler, with 'Rust' being the project where Alec Baldwin fatally shot Hutchins.
Prior to the fatal shooting on 'Rust', crew members raised safety concerns due to previous accidental prop gun discharges.
The shooting incident resulted in the death of Hutchins and injury of director Joel Souza.
Possible civil penalties could be imposed following the investigation by the New Mexico Occupational Health and Safety Bureau.
